facts.fact_text: The HCOB Germany Construction PMI fell to 44.7 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December, signaling a return to contraction.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Germany Construction PMI fell to 44.7 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December, signaling a return to contraction after the first expansion in almost four years.

facts.fact_text: New orders fell further, reflecting weak demand from housing, commercial projects, and local government.

evidences.evidence_text: New orders fell further, reflecting weak demand from housing, commercial projects, and local government.

facts.fact_text: Employment rose for the third consecutive month at the fastest pace since March 2022.

evidences.evidence_text: On a positive note, employment rose for the third consecutive month at the fastest pace since March 2022

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation reached a four-month high, alongside higher subcontractor charges.

evidences.evidence_text: Input cost inflation reached a four-month high, alongside higher subcontractor charges.

claims.claim_text: Business expectations turned positive for the first time since May 2025, marking the highest confidence since February 2020.

evidences.evidence_text: Despite ongoing challenges, business expectations turned positive for the first time since May 2025, marking the highest confidence since February 2020.

evidence.evidence_text: The HCOB Germany Construction PMI fell to 44.7 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December, signaling a return to contraction after the first expansion in almost four years.
New orders fell further, reflecting weak demand from housing, commercial projects, and local government.
Input cost inflation reached a four-month high, alongside higher subcontractor charges.
On a positive note, employment rose for the third consecutive month at the fastest pace since March 2022
